conclusion: To determine which container each of the liquids (A, B, and C) will flow into after passing through the baffles, analyze the path of the liquid as shown in the images.
Liquid A appears to be coming from the top-left (labeled A).
The orange baffle deflects Liquid A downwards.
Liquid A continues downwards and interacts with the green baffle.
Based on the path, Liquid A flows into Container E.
Liquid B appears to be coming from the middle-top (labeled B).
The purple baffle deflects Liquid B downwards.
Liquid B continues downwards and interacts with the green baffle.
Based on the path, Liquid B flows into Container E.
Liquid C appears to be coming from the top-right (labeled C).
The white baffle deflects Liquid C downwards.
Liquid C continues downwards and interacts with the brown baffle.
Based on the path, Liquid C flows into Container D.
Final Answer: Liquid A flows into Container E, Liquid B flows into Container E, and Liquid C flows into Container D.
